org.activebpel.rt.bpel
Class AeExpressionLanguageFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.AeExpressionLanguageFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeExpressionLanguageFactory
public class AeExpressionLanguageFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAeExpressionLanguageFactory

This implementation of the expression language factory uses the engine configuration file to map expression languages to implementations of validators and runners.

Field Summary
static java.lang.String FACTORIES_KEY
          The config map key to get the list of factories.
private  java.util.Map mFactoryMap
          The map of BPEL Namespace URI -> expression language factory.
private static java.util.Map sDefaultFatories
          The map/list of default languages when no config info is found in aeEngineConfig.xml.
private static java.util.Map sNamespaceMappings
          Maps one namespace to another when looking up factories.

AeExpressionLanguageFactory()

          Constructs an expression language factory using the given engine configuration map.

supportsLanguage

public boolean supportsLanguage(java.lang.String aBpelNamespace,
                                java.lang.String aLanguageUri)
Description copied from interface: IAeExpressionLanguageFactory
Returns true if the given language is supported by this expression language factory. If null or empty string is passed in, then this method should return true if the BPEL default language is supported (xpath 1.0).

Specified by:
supportsLanguage in interface IAeExpressionLanguageFactory
Parameters:

aLanguageUri -

addFactory

protected void addFactory(java.lang.String aNamespaceUri,
                          java.util.Map aMap)
                   throws AeException
Adds a language to the factory. The map contains all of the pieces of information (found in the engine config) needed to fully describe support for a single expression language. This includes the URL of the language, its name, and implementation classes for validation and execution.

Parameters:
aNamespaceUri -
aMap -
Throws:
AeException

protected java.lang.ClassLoader getFactoryClassloader()

createExpressionValidator

public IAeExpressionValidator createExpressionValidator(java.lang.String aBpelNamespace,
                                                        java.lang.String aLanguageUri)
                                                 throws AeException
Description copied from interface: IAeExpressionLanguageFactory
Given a language identifier found in the 'expressionLanguage' attribute of the BPEL 'process' element (or in a child BPEL constructs in 2.0), returns an expression validator capable of validating expressions written in that language. The BPEL process namespace must also be passed, since the behavior is different for different BPEL versions.

Specified by:
createExpressionValidator in interface IAeExpressionLanguageFactory
Parameters:
aBpelNamespace -
aLanguageUri -
Throws:
AeException
See Also:
IAeExpressionLanguageFactory.createExpressionValidator(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

createExpressionAnalyzer

public IAeExpressionAnalyzer createExpressionAnalyzer(java.lang.String aBpelNamespace,
                                                      java.lang.String aLanguageUri)
                                               throws AeException
Description copied from interface: IAeExpressionLanguageFactory
Given a language identifier found in the 'expressionLanguage' attribute of the BPEL 'process' element (or in a child BPEL constructs in 2.0), returns an expression analyzer capable of parsing and analyzing expressions written in that language. The BPEL process namespace must also be passed, since the behavior is different for different BPEL versions.

Specified by:

Given a language identifier found in the 'expressionLanguage' attribute of the BPEL 'process' element (or in a child BPEL constructs in 2.0), returns an expression runner capable of executing expressions written in that language. The BPEL process namespace must also be passed, since the behavior is different for different BPEL versions.
